get.summary: Get a list of all recommendation tasks

x-llm-hints.purpose: Retrieve current task-advisor recommendations for administrators.
usage: Call to populate the task-advisor dashboard when the page loads.
Poll periodically (e.g. every 60s) to surface new findings or auto-mitigations.
failure_modes: 200 [] when no recommendations are currently available

error_handling.action: Display an empty-state card explaining that no actions are required.

x-llm-hints.postprocessing_hint: Sort recommendations by updatedAt descending and badge muted entries so operators can restore them.

post.summary: Retry the backup on mon disks.

x-llm-hints.purpose: Retry failed backup operation on monitor disks to resolve backup-related advisor warnings.
usage: Call when task advisor shows backup failure warnings that need immediate resolution.
Use to manually trigger backup retry after resolving disk space or connectivity issues.

workflow_guidance.pre_check: Previous backup failure detected; Disk space available; Backup destination accessible
workflow_guidance.post_action: Backup operation retried; Advisor recommendations updated; Backup failure warning cleared if successful

failure_modes: 500 if backup still fails due to persistent disk or connectivity issues

error_handling.action: Check monitor disk space; verify backup destination accessibility; resolve underlying storage issues before retry.

x-llm-hints.postprocessing_hint: Retry executes immediately; backup success clears related advisor warnings; refresh advisor to see updated status.

post.summary: Apply a suggestion from an advisor recommendation

x-llm-hints.purpose: Execute a specific automated fix suggestion from task advisor to resolve cluster issues or warnings.
usage: Call to apply automatic remediation for advisor recommendations with available fixes.
Use when manual resolution is complex and advisor provides automated solution.

workflow_guidance.pre_check: Suggestion exists; Cluster state allows automated fix; Required permissions available
workflow_guidance.post_action: Automated fix executed; Task tracks progress; Recommendation cleared if successful; Cluster state updated

path_parameters.name: suggestionId
path_parameters.description: UUID of the suggestion to apply from advisor recommendation.

failure_modes: 404 if suggestion ID does not exist or has already been applied
500 if automated fix fails due to cluster state or permission issues

error_handling.action: Refresh advisor recommendations; verify suggestion ID exists and is still applicable.
Check cluster health; verify permissions; review automated fix logs for specific failure cause.

x-llm-hints.postprocessing_hint: Fix runs as managed task; monitor task progress; recommendation removed if successful; cluster changes take effect immediately.

patch.summary: Hide a task from the recommendation list

x-llm-hints.purpose: Hide or show task advisor recommendations to control which warnings are displayed to administrators.
usage: Call when specific recommendations are not relevant to current operations and should be hidden.
Use to manage recommendation visibility without deleting the underlying issue detection.

workflow_guidance.pre_check: Task recommendation exists; Valid hide value provided; Admin permissions verified
workflow_guidance.post_action: Recommendation visibility updated; UI reflects new display state; Underlying issue detection continues

request_parameters.name: hide
request_parameters.description: Set to true to hide recommendation, false to show it.

path_parameters.name: taskUuid
path_parameters.description: UUID of the task advisor recommendation to update.

failure_modes: 404 if task UUID does not exist in current recommendations

error_handling.action: Verify task UUID exists in advisor recommendations; refresh advisor list; check if recommendation expired.

x-llm-hints.postprocessing_hint: Visibility change is immediate; hidden recommendations can be shown again later; underlying checks continue regardless of visibility.

delete.summary: Remove a task identified by UUID

x-llm-hints.purpose: Permanently remove a task advisor recommendation to stop it from appearing in future scans.
usage: Call when a recommendation is no longer applicable due to architectural or policy changes.
Use to clean up obsolete recommendations that cannot be resolved through normal means.

path_parameters.name: taskUuid
path_parameters.description: Task advisor recommendation UUID to permanently delete.

failure_modes: 404 if task UUID does not exist or has already been deleted

error_handling.action: Task may have been already deleted or UUID is invalid; refresh recommendation list.

x-llm-hints.postprocessing_hint: Recommendation removed permanently; refresh task advisor dashboard to confirm removal.
x-llm-hints.confirmation_reason: Deleting recommendations permanently removes them from future advisor scans

x-llm-hints.purpose: Paginate through historical and active tasks with optional filtering and sorting.
usage: Load the task history view with pagination controls.
Filter tasks by state or name when auditing recent maintenance operations.

request_parameters.name: pagination
request_parameters.description: PaginationRequest JSON supporting where/order/limit clauses (e.g. {"limit":50,"where":[{"state":{"_eq":"FAILED"}}]}).

common_parameters.pagination.where.state: Filter to RUNNING/FAILED to focus on tasks needing action.
common_parameters.pagination.order.startedAt: Sort descending to view the newest tasks first.

failure_modes: 200 with data=[] when no tasks match the filter

error_handling.action: Relax filters or expand the time range before retrying.

x-llm-hints.postprocessing_hint: Use `total` and `limit` to drive pagination UI; hide sensitive task names from non-admin users as returned.

get.summary: Get all currently active tasks (running or waiting).

x-llm-hints.purpose: List all tasks that are currently RUNNING or WAITING.
usage: Drive dashboards that show live operational activity.
Poll after submitting work to present users with any tasks that still require monitoring or interaction.
failure_modes: 200 [] when there are no active tasks

error_handling.action: Show a no-active-tasks message and stop polling until new tasks are created.

x-llm-hints.postprocessing_hint: Sort by startedAt descending and flag WAITING tasks that might require manual approval (question != null).

x-llm-hints.purpose: Fetch status snapshots for multiple tasks in one request.
usage: Poll in bulk when coordinating several concurrent background jobs.
Use after starting a batch of tasks to detect which ones still require attention.

request_parameters.name: id
request_parameters.description: Repeatable query parameter listing task ids to inspect (e.g. id=12&id=34).

failure_modes: 200 [] when none of the supplied task ids are active or visible

error_handling.action: If expected tasks are missing, query GET /tasks/{id} individually or reload the task history.

x-llm-hints.postprocessing_hint: Map responses by id; treat missing entries as completed, purged, or permission filtered tasks.

x-llm-hints.purpose: Retrieve the latest status snapshot for a single long-running task.
usage: Call immediately after an endpoint returns a ManagedTask to track its execution until completion.
Use while showing a task detail drawer to stream progress, log output, and pending questions.

path_parameters.name: id
path_parameters.description: Numeric task identifier returned when the task was started.

failure_modes: 404 if the task id is unknown or filtered (e.g. non-admins requesting sensitive tasks)

error_handling.action: Confirm the id, ensure sufficient permissions, then fall back to GET /tasks/status for batch checks.

x-llm-hints.postprocessing_hint: Stop polling once done=true; treat statusCode 0 as success, -256 as user cancel, others as failure, and surface question tokens when present.

x-llm-hints.purpose: Provide an answer to a task question to allow the task to continue execution.
usage: Call when a task is waiting for user input and shows a question in its status.
Use to respond to confirmation prompts or provide configuration choices for running tasks.

workflow_guidance.pre_check: Task exists; Task has pending question; Answer token is current; Response is valid option
workflow_guidance.post_action: Answer recorded; Task resumes execution; Question cleared from task status

request_parameters.name: token
request_parameters.description: Question token from the task status to ensure answer matches current question.

request_parameters.name: response
request_parameters.description: Answer text matching one of the available response options.

path_parameters.name: id
path_parameters.description: Numeric task identifier that has a pending question.

failure_modes: 400 if question token is invalid or question has already been answered
400 if response does not match available options
404 if task does not exist or has no pending question

error_handling.action: Refresh task status to get current question token; verify response matches available options.
Check task exists and has question field populated in status response.

x-llm-hints.postprocessing_hint: Answer submission immediately unblocks task execution; monitor task status for progress continuation; question disappears after answer.

x-llm-hints.purpose: Cancel a running or waiting task to stop its execution and free system resources.
usage: Call when a long-running task needs to be stopped due to changed requirements or errors.
Use to abort tasks that are stuck waiting for user input or taking too long to complete.

workflow_guidance.pre_check: Task exists; Task is running or waiting; User has admin permissions
workflow_guidance.post_action: Cancellation signal sent; Task will terminate gracefully; Status becomes cancelled

failure_modes: 404 if task ID does not exist or is not visible to current user
400 if task is already completed or cannot be cancelled

error_handling.action: Verify task ID exists and is accessible; check task may have already completed.
Task may be in final state; refresh task status to confirm current state.

x-llm-hints.postprocessing_hint: Task cancellation is asynchronous; monitor task status to confirm termination; cancelled tasks show statusCode -256.

get.summary: List all known users (local, LDAP and OIDC included).

x-llm-hints.purpose: Retrieve a comprehensive list of all user accounts from local database, LDAP, and OIDC providers.
usage: Call to display user management dashboards and overview screens.
Use for audit purposes to see all users with access to the system.

workflow_guidance.pre_check: Authentication providers (LDAP/OIDC) are accessible if configured
workflow_guidance.post_action: Filter or paginate results for display; differentiate local vs external users

request_parameters.name: pagination
request_parameters.description: Optional pagination parameters to limit and offset results.

failure_modes: 200 with partial results if LDAP/OIDC providers are temporarily unavailable
500 if database access fails

error_handling.action: Check response for provider warnings; external users may be missing during provider outages.
Database connectivity issue; retry or check system health.

x-llm-hints.postprocessing_hint: Combines local accounts with external provider data; excludes API tokens; accounts from external providers have negative IDs; pagination applies to merged results.

post.summary: Create a new croit user. Returns the ID of the new user.

x-llm-hints.purpose: Create a new local croit user account with specified username and role permissions.
usage: Call when adding new users to the local authentication system.
Use to provision user accounts with appropriate viewer or admin access levels.

workflow_guidance.pre_check: Username is unique; Valid role configuration; Not using API token authentication
workflow_guidance.post_action: User account created; Username and roles stored; Account ID returned for reference

request_parameters.name: username
request_parameters.description: Unique username for the new account.

request_parameters.name: roles
request_parameters.description: List of role permissions to assign (admin users need both ADMIN and VIEWER roles).

failure_modes: 400 if username already exists or is invalid format
400 if role configuration is invalid
403 if called by an API token user

error_handling.action: Choose unique username; ensure admin users have both ADMIN and VIEWER roles; verify username format.
User creation is restricted to interactive user sessions; API tokens cannot create users.

x-llm-hints.postprocessing_hint: Account creation is immediate; new user can log in with generated credentials; admin users require both ADMIN and VIEWER roles.

patch.summary: Update roles of an OIDC user.

x-llm-hints.purpose: Update role permissions for an OIDC user account without affecting their identity provider authentication.
usage: Call when OIDC user responsibilities change and need different access levels in croit.
Use to manage role assignments for users authenticated through external identity providers.

workflow_guidance.pre_check: OIDC provider exists; User subject exists; Valid role configuration; Interactive session used
workflow_guidance.post_action: OIDC user roles updated; Changes effective immediately; Identity provider authentication unchanged

request_parameters.name: roles
request_parameters.description: New list of roles to assign (admin users need both ADMIN and VIEWER roles).

path_parameters.name: id
path_parameters.description: OIDC provider ID that authenticates this user.

path_parameters.name: subject
path_parameters.description: User subject identifier from the OIDC provider.

failure_modes: 400 if OIDC provider or user subject does not exist
400 if role configuration is invalid
403 if called by an API token instead of user session

error_handling.action: Verify OIDC provider exists; confirm user subject is correct; ensure admin users have both roles.
User management restricted to interactive sessions; API tokens cannot modify users.

x-llm-hints.postprocessing_hint: Role changes are immediate; affects croit permissions only; OIDC authentication and identity remain unchanged.

x-llm-hints.purpose: Delete an OIDC user and immediately invalidate all their active sessions.
usage: Call when removing OIDC users who no longer need access to the system.
Use to clean up user accounts when users are removed from the identity provider.

workflow_guidance.pre_check: OIDC user exists; Provider configuration is valid; Admin has interactive session
workflow_guidance.post_action: OIDC user deleted; All user sessions immediately invalidated; User cannot authenticate via OIDC

path_parameters.name: id
path_parameters.description: OIDC provider ID that manages this user.

path_parameters.name: subject
path_parameters.description: Unique subject identifier from the OIDC provider.

failure_modes: 403 if called by an API token instead of user session
404 if OIDC user or provider does not exist

error_handling.action: Use an interactive admin session for security when managing OIDC user accounts.
User may have already been deleted or OIDC provider configuration changed.

x-llm-hints.postprocessing_hint: Session invalidation happens immediately; user will be logged out of all active sessions; only affects croit access (OIDC provider unchanged).
x-llm-hints.confirmation_reason: Deleting OIDC users will immediately terminate all their sessions and remove access

x-llm-hints.purpose: Update role permissions for a local croit user account while ensuring at least one admin remains.
usage: Call when user responsibilities change and need different access levels.
Use to grant or revoke permissions while maintaining administrative access to the system.

workflow_guidance.pre_check: User exists; Valid role configuration; Admin safety preserved; Interactive session used
workflow_guidance.post_action: User roles updated; Changes effective immediately; Admin protection maintained

request_parameters.name: roles
request_parameters.description: New list of roles to assign (admin users need both ADMIN and VIEWER roles).

failure_modes: 400 if user ID does not exist or role configuration is invalid
400 if removing admin role would leave no admin users
403 if called by an API token instead of user session

error_handling.action: Verify user exists; ensure admin users have both roles; maintain at least one admin in system.
User management restricted to interactive sessions; API tokens cannot modify users.

x-llm-hints.postprocessing_hint: Role changes are immediate; user may lose current access; system ensures at least one admin remains active.
x-llm-hints.confirmation_reason: Role changes affect user permissions immediately and must preserve admin access

delete.summary: Delete a local croit user account.

x-llm-hints.purpose: Delete a local croit user account while ensuring at least one admin user remains.
usage: Call when removing users who no longer need access to the system.
Use for cleanup when decommissioning user accounts from local authentication.

workflow_guidance.pre_check: User exists; At least one other local admin account exists if deleting admin; Interactive session required
workflow_guidance.post_action: User account deleted; User sessions invalidated; User cannot log in with local credentials

path_parameters.name: id
path_parameters.description: User ID to delete from the local database.

failure_modes: 403 if called by an API token instead of user session
400 if attempting to delete the last admin account
404 if the specified user ID does not exist

error_handling.action: Use an interactive admin session for security when managing user accounts.
Create another local admin account before deleting the last one; LDAP/OIDC accounts are unaffected.
User may have already been deleted; refresh user list to verify.

x-llm-hints.postprocessing_hint: Account deletion is immediate; existing sessions remain valid until expiry; only affects local accounts (LDAP/OIDC users managed externally).
x-llm-hints.confirmation_reason: Deleting user accounts will permanently remove their access and cannot be undone

put.summary: Change the password of a local croit user.

x-llm-hints.purpose: Change the password for a local croit user account with appropriate authorization checks.
usage: Call when users need to update their passwords or admins need to reset user passwords.
Use for password security maintenance allowing self-service password changes and admin resets.

workflow_guidance.pre_check: User exists; Account is local (not LDAP); Interactive session; Admin permissions for other users
workflow_guidance.post_action: Password updated securely; User can login with new password; Password change logged

request_parameters.name: password
request_parameters.description: New password for the user account (cannot be blank).

path_parameters.name: id
path_parameters.description: User account ID for password change.

failure_modes: 400 if password is blank or user is LDAP-managed
403 if called by API token or non-admin changing another user's password
404 if user ID does not exist

error_handling.action: Provide non-blank password; cannot change passwords for LDAP-managed users.
Use interactive session; only admins can change other users' passwords; users can change their own password.
Verify user ID exists and is a local (non-LDAP) account.

x-llm-hints.postprocessing_hint: Password change is immediate; user must use new password for next login; password is securely hashed and stored; operation is audited.
